intro: Inversodicraea botswana, commonly known as the Botswana thornveld plant, is a perennial shrub native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are often small and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. The flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish-white, attracting pollinators such as bees and moths.
